question: Rake angle is:
correct_answer: Angle between rake face & axis of bur
options: A)Angle between rake face & clearance face
B)Angle between rake face & axis of bur
C)Angle between clearance face & axis of bur
prompt:
Rake angle is:A)Angle between rake face & clearance face
B)Angle between rake face & axis of bur
C)Angle between clearance face & axis of bur
D)Angle between tooth & rake face
output0: The rake angle is the angle between the rake face and the clearance face of a cutting tool. It is an important parameter in the analysis of the cutting process and is used to calculate the depth of cut and the cutting force.
output1: The rake angle is the angle between the rake face and the axis of the bur. This angle is important in determining the amount of material that will be removed during the cutting process.
output2: The correct answer is C)Angle between clearance face & axis of bur. The rake angle is the angle between the clearance face and the axis of the bur, which is the angle that the bur makes with the rock as it cuts into it.
output3: The correct answer is D)Angle between tooth & rake face. This is the angle between the tooth face and the rake face of a tooth. This angle is important in determining the amount of material that can be cut with a single tooth, and is used to calculate the cutting efficiency of a tooth.

question: What phenotype would you expect in an individual in whom an immunodeficiency caused by a mutation homozygous for the CD3ε chain that prevents the expression of this molecular complex has been described ?:
correct_answer: It will only be able to perform an innate and adaptive humoral response Tindependiente.
options: A)Inability to perform an immune response in any situation.
B)Inability to perform cellular responses to viruses and intracellular bacteria, but with a normal humoral response.
C)It will only be able to perform an innate and adaptive humoral response Tindependiente.
D)Problems to perform responses to extracellular bacteria and fungi.
prompt:
What phenotype would you expect in an individual in whom an immunodeficiency caused by a mutation homozygous for the CD3ε chain that prevents the expression of this molecular complex has been described ?:A)Inability to perform an immune response in any situation.
B)Inability to perform cellular responses to viruses and intracellular bacteria, but with a normal humoral response.
C)It will only be able to perform an innate and adaptive humoral response Tindependiente.
D)Problems to perform responses to extracellular bacteria and fungi.
output0: An individual with a homozygous mutation of the CD3ε chain would not be able to express the molecular complex, which is essential for the proper functioning of the immune system. This would result in a complete absence of immune response in any situation.
output1: An individual in whom an immunodeficiency caused by a mutation homozygous for the CD3ε chain that prevents the expression of this molecular complex would have difficulty performing cellular responses to viruses and intracellular bacteria, as these responses require the CD3ε chain to be present. However, their humoral response would be normal, as it is not dependent on the CD3ε chain.
output2: The mutation homozygous for the CD3ε chain prevents the expression of this molecular complex, which is essential for the activation of T cells. As a result, the individual will not be able to perform an adaptive immune response, which includes cellular responses to viruses and intracellular bacteria. However, they will still be able to perform an innate and adaptive humoral response.
output3: An individual with a homozygous mutation in the CD3ε chain would have a defect in the T-cell receptor complex, which is essential for T-cell activation and immune response. This would result in a deficiency in the immune response to extracellular bacteria and fungi, but not to intracellular pathogens or viruses.

question: According to the Astler-Coller staging system, colorectal cancer if the tumor cells have been violated body muscle layer (muscularis propria) but not yet transferred to the lymph nodes, its staging:
prompt:
According to the Astler-Coller staging system, colorectal cancer if the tumor cells have been violated body muscle layer (muscularis propria) but not yet transferred to the lymph nodes, its staging:A)A
B)B
C)C
D)D
output0: The Astler-Coller staging system is a staging system used to classify colorectal cancer. According to the system, if the tumor cells have not yet invaded the lymph nodes and have only violated the body muscle layer (muscularis propria), the cancer is considered to be in stage A.
output1: According to the Astler-Coller staging system, if the tumor cells have penetrated the muscularis propria but have not yet spread to the lymph nodes, the cancer is classified as stage B. This is because the tumor has already spread beyond the mucosa and is growing into the deeper layers of the colon, which is a more advanced stage of cancer.
output2: According to the Astler-Coller staging system, if the tumor cells have penetrated the muscularis propria but have not yet spread to the lymph nodes, the cancer is classified as stage C.
output3: The Astler-Coller staging system is a classification system for colorectal cancer. According to this system, if the tumor cells have not yet invaded the muscularis propria (the layer of smooth muscle in the wall of the colon or rectum) but have spread to the lymph nodes, the staging is D)D.

question: Which of the following compounds is an activator of gluconeogenesis ?:
prompt:
Which of the following compounds is an activator of gluconeogenesis ?:A)Fructose-2,6-bisphosphate.
B)Fructose-1,6-bisphosphate.
C)Acetyl-CoA.
D)AMP.
output0: Fructose-2,6-bisphosphate is an activator of gluconeogenesis because it is a precursor of glucose-6-phosphate, which is a key intermediate in the pathway.
output1: Fructose-1,6-bisphosphate is an activator of gluconeogenesis because it is a precursor of glucose-6-phosphate, which is the first step in the synthesis of glucose from non-carbohydrate sources.
output2: Acetyl-CoA is an activator of gluconeogenesis, as it is the starting material for the synthesis of glucose from non-carbohydrate sources. Fructose-2,6-bisphosphate and fructose-1,6-bisphosphate are both inhibitors of gluconeogenesis, while AMP is not directly involved in the process.
output3: AMP (adenosine monophosphate) is an activator of gluconeogenesis, as it is a precursor of ATP, which is the primary energy source for the synthesis of glucose.

question: Chlamydia trachomatis infection commonly causes:March 2004
prompt:
Chlamydia trachomatis infection commonly causes:March 2004A)Infeility
B)Post coital bleeding
C)Amenorrhoea
D)Malignancy
output0: Chlamydia trachomatis infection is a common cause of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID), which can lead to infertility if left untreated.
output1: Chlamydia trachomatis infection can cause post coital bleeding in women.
output2: Chlamydia trachomatis infection can cause amenorrhoea, which is the absence of menstruation. This is because the infection can cause inflammation in the reproductive organs, leading to scarring and damage to the fallopian tubes and ovaries. This damage can disrupt the normal menstrual cycle and cause amenorrhoea.
output3: Chlamydia trachomatis infection is a common cause of malignancy, particularly in women. The infection can lead to the development of cervical cancer, which is a serious and potentially fatal disease.

question: If the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm and the station of the head is at -1, weight of the fetus is approximately
prompt:
If the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm and the station of the head is at -1, weight of the fetus is approximatelyA)3 kg
B)3.3 kg
C)4 kg
D)4.3 kg
output0: The formula for estimating fetal weight is: weight = (symphysiofundal height x 100) / station of the head. In this case, the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm, and the station of the head is at -1. Plugging these values into the formula, we get: weight = (40 x 100) / -1 = 3 kg.
output1: The formula to estimate the weight of the fetus is: weight = (symphysiofundal height x 100) / station of the head. In this case, the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm and the station of the head is -1, so the weight of the fetus would be: weight = (40 x 100) / -1 = 3.3 kg.
output2: The weight of the fetus can be estimated using the formula: weight = (symphysiofundal height x 100) / station of the head. In this case, the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm and the station of the head is -1, so the estimated weight of the fetus is:
output3: To calculate the weight of the fetus, we need to use the formula: weight = (symphysiofundal height x 100) / station of the head. In this case, the symphysiofundal height is 40 cm and the station of the head is -1, so we can calculate the weight as follows: weight = (40 x 100) / -1 = 4300 / -1 = 4.3 kg. Therefore, the correct answer is D)4.3 kg.

question: 10 year-old girl touched the right side of the areola lumps about the size of 2 cm, a little tenderness, of the following statements is wrong?
options: B)Left breast may also appear soon symmetrical lumps
prompt:
10 year-old girl touched the right side of the areola lumps about the size of 2 cm, a little tenderness, of the following statements is wrong?A)Most likely prepubertal gynecomastia
B)Left breast may also appear soon symmetrical lumps
C)Observe track (follow-up) to
D)Arrangements breast biopsy (biopsy)
output0: The presence of lumps on one side of the areola, with a size of 2 cm, is most likely a sign of prepubertal gynecomastia, which is a common condition in boys and girls during early puberty. The tenderness of the lumps suggests that they are not cancerous. The other options are not relevant to this condition.
output1: The statement B)Left breast may also appear soon symmetrical lumps is incorrect because it is not a common presentation of prepubertal gynecomastia. Prepubertal gynecomastia typically presents as unilateral breast enlargement, with the right side being more common than the left. Symmetrical lumps on both breasts are less common.
output2: The correct answer is C)Observe track (follow-up) to. The Turtle Technique is not a diagnostic tool, but rather a therapeutic approach. The lumps on the girl's right breast are most likely prepubertal gynecomastia, which is a common condition in girls during this age range. Therefore, the correct course of action would be to observe the child's development and track any changes, rather than immediately scheduling a biopsy.
output3: The statement "Arrangements breast biopsy (biopsy)" is incorrect because prepubertal gynecomastia is not a condition that requires a breast biopsy. Instead, the appropriate course of action would be to observe the child's development and perform a follow-up (track) to monitor any changes.

question: Plateau phase in action potential is seen in cells of:
prompt:
Plateau phase in action potential is seen in cells of:A)SA node
B)AV node
C)Purkinje fibres
D)Atrial fibres
output0: The plateau phase in the action potential is seen in the cells of the SA node, which is the pacemaker of the heart. This is where the heart's natural pacemaker is located, and it is responsible for generating the electrical impulses that regulate the heart's rhythm.
output1: The plateau phase in action potential is seen in cells of the AV node. This phase is characterized by a prolonged depolarization of the cell membrane, which allows for the transmission of the action potential.
output2: The plateau phase in action potential is seen in Purkinje fibres, which are found in the cerebellum. This phase is characterized by a prolonged depolarization of the fibres, which allows for the transmission of information from the cerebellum to other parts of the brain.
output3: The plateau phase in action potential is seen in atrial fibres. This phase is characterized by a prolonged depolarization of the cell membrane, which allows the electrical signal to spread more effectively throughout the heart.

question: Using the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification technique DNA, the reaction temperature of up to 95 deg.] C object temperature cycling why?
options: C)Increase the activity of DNA polymerase
prompt:
Using the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification technique DNA, the reaction temperature of up to 95 deg.] C object temperature cycling why?A)Forming single-stranded template (template) DNA
B)The primer and template (template) combined
C)Increase the activity of DNA polymerase
D)Facilitate purification of the product
output0: The reaction temperature of up to 95 deg.] C object temperature cycling is used in the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification technique to form single-stranded template DNA. This is necessary because the PCR reaction requires a single-stranded template to be amplified.
output1: The PCR amplification technique uses thermal cycling to bring the primer and template DNA together, allowing the DNA polymerase to synthesize a new strand of DNA. The high temperature of up to 95°C is necessary to denature the double-stranded DNA template, allowing the primers to bind to the template and initiate the PCR reaction.
output2: The PCR amplification technique relies on the activity of DNA polymerase to synthesize new DNA strands. The high reaction temperature (up to 95 deg.] C) is used to increase the activity of DNA polymerase, which helps to amplify the target DNA sequence more efficiently.
output3: The PCR amplification technique uses thermal cycling to facilitate the purification of the product. The high temperature (up to 95 deg.] C) is used to melt the DNA and separate the desired fragments from the rest of the genetic material.

question: Most commonly missing tooth is
prompt:
Most commonly missing tooth isA)Upper 3rd molar
B)Lower 3rd molar
C)Upper lateral incisor
D)Lower 2nd premolar
output0: The upper 3rd molar is the most commonly missing tooth in children. This is because it is the last tooth to erupt and is often the last tooth to fall out.
output1: The lower 3rd molar is the most commonly missing tooth in children, especially those in the last courses of Primary Education. This is because the lower 3rd molar is the last tooth to erupt in the mouth and is therefore more likely to be missing due to delayed eruption or other developmental issues.
output2: The upper lateral incisor is the most commonly missing tooth in children, especially in the 6-12 year age range. This is because this tooth is located in the front of the mouth and is more prone to trauma and decay.
output3: The lower 2nd premolar is the most commonly missing tooth in children, especially those in the last courses of Primary Education. This is because it is located in the posterior region of the mouth, which is more prone to tooth loss due to injury or decay.
